author: sky.cactus
content: Are access list addresses and slots encoded as QUANTITY or DATA?

author: sky.cactus
content: (do we strip leading 0s before RLP encoding the byte arrays?)

author: sky.cactus
content: It *appears* they are encoded as `DATA`, which is unfortunate since that is a whole lot of wasted bytes on the wire it would seem.

author: sky.cactus
content: (most referenced storage slots will likely be low numbers)

author: .vbuterin
content: Addresses are always data

author: .vbuterin
content: > which is unfortunate since that is a whole lot of wasted bytes on the wire it would seem

author: .vbuterin
content: Wait, don't we use snappy compression on the wire already?

author: sky.cactus
content: Hmm, do we for devp2p?

author: sky.cactus
content: I don't write any devp2p code, so I don't know.

author: sky.cactus
content: Also snappy on disk?

author: sky.cactus
content: The addresses make sense as data.

author: sky.cactus
content: It is the inner array that makes less sense as data (from a compression standpoint).

author: .vbuterin
content: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-706

author: sky.cactus
content: Referenced storage slots will often be low numbers due to how Solidity uses them.

author: ajsutton
content: Both rocksdb and leveldb can be configured to compress stored data.

author: burpnado
content:
Hello!
1. I launched geth (<1.10.5) without specifying miner.gasLimit. By default, it is 8M. However, this node is mining blocks with total gaslimit 15M. Why is that?
2. After updating the node to 1.10.6, do I need to specify the miner.gasLimit parameter? If so, which value should be set? Thanks.

author: timbeiko
content: Yes, please use this channel. People already know about it, and itâ€™s hard to imagine anything more relevant to discuss here than the actual fork on the day of ðŸ˜…

author: timbeiko
content: Not sure about 1, but if you are a miner,  you want to put 30M as your miner.gasLimit after London

author: schone_wizard
content: can they change it before the fork to that?

author: timbeiko
content: They can but it is not ideal because it will then raise the ore-fork blocks up to 30m. The London post at blog.ethereum.org has an explanation

author: suburbandad_
content:
FYI, late yesterday we discovered a defect in besu which affected value transfer transactions.  It isn't a consensus critical bug, but we are highly recommending folks to upgrade to 21.7.2 to fix this issue:

https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/issues/2606

author: suburbandad_
content: https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/releases/tag/21.7.2

author: schone_wizard
content: I guess my question is when in the timeline are miners expected to shut down and restart their geth process if we have a pre and post fork diff values

author: timbeiko
content: They donâ€™t need to shut anything down: you can update the limit via a JSON RPC call

author: schone_wizard
content: Oh

author: schone_wizard
content: Okay that makes sense now. Thanks ðŸ™‚

author: peachmufffin
content: I should execute `miner.SetGasLimit(30000000)`  in my geth console, right?

author: 0xsadcat
content: yes (note it's setGasLimit - small s)
